subs.text: @joshtpm But: Weren’t those boxes material that the Archives was expecting? In other words, documents that had already been cataloged? Which means these would be specific documents known by name and not by content?
subs.rawText: @joshtpm But: Weren’t those boxes material that the Archives was expecting? In other words, documents that had already been cataloged? Which means these would be specific documents known by name and not by content?

subs.text: @joshtpm Which is to say, not plans for stealth fighters, but documents generated in the course of ordinary business (and automatically named) but not yet archived?
subs.rawText: @joshtpm Which is to say, not plans for stealth fighters, but documents generated in the course of ordinary business (and automatically named) but not yet archived?

subs.text: @joshtpm If that is the case — and I could well be misremembering the facts of the Archives reporting — documents from 1/6 would fit the bill.
subs.rawText: @joshtpm If that is the case — and I could well be misremembering the facts of the Archives reporting — documents from 1/6 would fit the bill.

subs.text: @joshtpm Could possibly be the sort of memo or emailed order to the National Guard that used to be called “a smoking gun” back in the day.

subs.text: @alangblake @joshtpm First, reported income over 500k doesn’t include the people earning 500k but reporting 200k — committing $100k fraud. Each year. So well more than $150k for a multi year audit.
